items.title: ASP.NET Boilerplate IRepository extension method
items.body:
For Organization Units, we used the code below to get entities in an Organization Unit including its child Organization Units. Is it reasonable and how to extend the IRepository to add this feature to all entities?

public virtual List<Product> GetProductsInOuIncludingChildren(long organizationUnitId)
{
    var code = _organizationUnitRepository.Get(organizationUnitId).Code;

    var query =
        from product in _productRepository.GetAll()
        join organizationUnit in _organizationUnitRepository.GetAll() on product.OrganizationUnitId equals organizationUnit.Id
        where organizationUnit.Code.StartsWith(code)
        select product;

    return query.ToList();
}

items.title: How to make HTTP POST request with url encoded body in flutter?
items.body:
I'm trying to make an post request in flutter with content type as url encoded. When I write body : json.encode(data), it encodes to plain text.

If I write body: data I get the error type '_InternalLinkedHashMap<String, dynamic>' is not a subtype of type 'String' in type cast

This is the data object

var match = {
  "homeTeam": {"team": "Team A"},
  "awayTeam": {"team": "Team B"}
};

And my request

var response = await post(Uri.parse(url),
    headers: {
      "Accept": "application/json",
      "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    },
    body: match,
    encoding: Encoding.getByName("utf-8"));

items.title: Socket.IO broadcast performance
items.body:
I'm making a real-time bidding app which utilizes Socket.IO. One thing that made me wonder if there will be performance issues when it comes to updating the current bid. Say I have this example: 

socket.on('bid', (auction_id, bid) => {
    //Do bidding validation stuff here...
    io.sockets.emit('new_bid', {auction_id: auction_id});
});

In this code, it will emit the message to ALL sockets connected, which means that people who are not on that specific auction page with the auction_id, socket.io will still send the data (even if there is no event listener on the client).

I want to know if it is a big performance issue to do it this way and if I should put sockets into rooms (once someone opens an auction page, they would enter the auction_${auction_id} room) instead?

items.title: android - dynamically adding a button to a custom dialogbox
items.body:
I am writing an android app, I have an activity, inside it i have a button, and it's on click listener opens a dialog box from a custom XML using the following code:

I would like to add that dialog box another button that is not set in it's XML file.

All the components are excising in the XML and working just fine, the dialog opens but I can't add the b button.

this.addCheer.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View v) {
                final Dialog d = new Dialog(map.this);
                LinearLayout layout = findViewById(R.id.dialog_layout_root);
                LayoutInflater layoutInflater = d.getLayoutInflater();
                d.requestWindowFeature(Window.FEATURE_NO_TITLE);
                d.setContentView(R.layout.cheer_dialog);// custom layout for the dialog
                WindowManager.LayoutParams lp = new WindowManager.LayoutParams();
                lp.copyFrom(d.getWindow().getAttributes());
                lp.width = WindowManager.LayoutParams.MATCH_PARENT;
                lp.height = WindowManager.LayoutParams.MATCH_PARENT;
                d.show();
                d.getWindow().setAttributes(lp);
                final EditText title = d.findViewById(R.id.cheerDialogText);

                ImageButton addCheerOk = (ImageButton) d.findViewById(R.id.addCheerOk);

                Button b = new Button(d.getContext());
                b.setText("yo");

                cheerDialogLayout.addView(b, new ViewGroup.LayoutParams(ViewGroup.LayoutParams.FILL_PARENT, ViewGroup.LayoutParams.FILL_PARENT));
}

I tried to use this example but it does not work for me. What am i doing wrong here? Thanks!

items.title: FragmentManager.getFragmens().size() returns inconsistent size;
items.body:
I am relatively new to Android, in order to check if the fragment is already in the stack I am getting the list of fragments from the FragmentManager, later iterate the list and check if fragments there then I would be loading that accordingly. Problem is get a NPE when I check for the name of fragment in the below piece of code even after having a null check. Any ideas.... Please help.

 if (null != frags) {
        for (int i = 0; i <frags.size(); i++) {
            if (frags.get(i).getClass().getName() == backStateName) {// NPE at getclass while juggling fragments in and out of the stack
                Fragment frag = frags.get(i);

                FragmentTransaction ft = manager.beginTransaction();
                ft.replace(R.id.event_frame, frag);
                ft.commit();

                return;
            }
        }
    }

items.title: Joining multiple tables using PHP relating to a member id
items.body:
I'm really hoping that you can clear things up for me regarding JOIN using php as I'm really struggling to come to terms with how it works.

Basically I have 2 tables, one for premium members and another for fans of these members. So I want to get certain information from the "premium" table where a member ($memberid) is a fan.

Premium = id, name, avatar, town, etc, etc
Fans = fan($memberid), fanee(Premium ID)

So I have this code at the moment:

<?php
$get_connections_sql = "SELECT id, name, avatar, town FROM premium LEFT JOIN fans ON fans.fanee=premium.id WHERE fans.fan=$memberid LIMIT 18";
$get_connections_res = mysqli_query($con, $get_connections_sql);
if(mysqli_affected_rows($con)>0){
    while ($connections = mysqli_fetch_assoc($get_connections_res)){
        $connectionid = $connections['id'];
        $connectionname = $connections['name'];
        $connectiontown = $connections['town'];
        $connectionavatar = $connections['avatar'];

    $connections .= "

        <div class=\"connectionHolder\"><img class=\"connection\" src=\"uploads/avatars/pro/$connectionavatar\" /></div>

    ";
    }
}else{

    $connections = "

        <div class=\"noContent\">There are no connections to be shown</div>

    ";

}
?>

This is returning the else condition so there must be something wrong with my JOIN row - Can anyone please point me in the right direction.

items.body_markdown: I am working on barking geckos, a gecko that calls kind of like a frog. I have various recording devices that are out recording their calls for hours, and I want to speed up my analysis of this call data, by automating the call identification and clipping process. I basically want a program to recognise individual calls, and clip them as separate files from a long soundtrack, for further analysis. Is there an R-package which can achieve something like this?
items.title: Clip individual calls from audio track
items.body: I am working on barking geckos, a gecko that calls kind of like a frog. I have various recording devices that are out recording their calls for hours, and I want to speed up my analysis of this call data, by automating the call identification and clipping process. I basically want a program to recognise individual calls, and clip them as separate files from a long soundtrack, for further analysis. Is there an R-package which can achieve something like this?

items.body_markdown: I am using a `PUT` request in my Rails application. Now, a new HTTP verb, `PATCH` has been implemented by browsers. So, I want to know what the main difference between `PATCH` and `PUT` requests are, and when we should use one or the other.
items.title: What is the main difference between PATCH and PUT request?
items.body: I am using a PUT request in my Rails application. Now, a new HTTP verb, PATCH has been implemented by browsers. So, I want to know what the main difference between PATCH and PUT requests are, and when we should use one or the other.

items.title: angular2 hide mdtooltip after clicking
items.body:
I am creating a sidebar. It should be composed by many icons, and when a user click on a specific Icon, redirect to a corresponding page. but the problem is after clicking on a icon, tooltip (from angular2-material) does not hide, and after each click on a icon, its tooltip becomes fixed.

<md-sidenav-layout id="nav_container">
<md-sidenav #start opened="true" mode="side">
    <md-nav-list>
        <div id="nav_container">
            <ul id="navigation">
                <li>
                    <a routerLink="/groups" routerLinkActive="active">
                        <md-icon   >home</md-icon>
                    </a>
                </li>
                <li>
                    <a routerLink="/contacts"  >
                        <md-icon md-tooltip="Contacts" onclick="iconClick" *ngIf="isFocues" >supervisor_account</md-icon>
                    </a>
                </li>

            </ul>
        </div>
    </md-nav-list>
</md-sidenav>

How can I hide tooltips after 10ms ?

Many thanks

I try to create node in the graph.db and get this error:

    Neo.DatabaseError.General.UnknownError: IdAllocation state is probably corrupted or out of sync with the cluster. Local highId is 573057 and allocation range is IdRange[32768-33791, defrag []]

My DB was migrated from Neo4j Community Edition (neo4j-community-3.0.6) to Enterprise (neo4j-enterprise-3.2.3) by copying binaries and upgrading it.  Then I configured Causal Cluster.

Here is log from debug.log:

    2018-04-12 07:11:43.870+0000 ERROR [o.n.b.v.r.ErrorReporter] Client triggered an unexpected error [UnknownError]: IdAllocation state is probably corrupted or out of sync with the cluster. Local highId is 573057 and allocation range is IdRange[15360-16383, defrag []], reference 2ca1aca3-3a60-441c-9fe1-dbd431ae400a. items.title: No Message error when submitting a post request
items.body:
I'm trying to post data to a database using a post request. I'm also using data from an Input in a previous page.

I.e

  • User visits profile & adds info into a form
  • The form data is posted to a controller and then create view returned with input data
  • The form in the create view is pre-populated by the previous data (from controller)
  • the user should be able to submit the form, but it throws no message error

I've noticed the URL is /prebook opposed to /booking/create (this is due to the profile page passing data into a controller and it outputting.

Any ideas?

Profile Controller

public function prebook() {

        $date = Input::get('query', '01/01/2010');
        $guests = Input::get('guests', '2');
        $restaurant = Input::get('restaurantID', '2');
        $restaurantName = Input::get('restaurantName', '2');
        $time = Input::get('timeFrom', '2');

        return view('userbookings.create')->with('date', $date)
                                          ->with('guests', $guests)
                                          ->with('restaurant', $restaurant)
                                          ->with('restaurantName', $restaurantName)
                                          ->with('time', $time);

}

Post form code 

{!! Form::open(array('route' => 'user.bookings.store','method'=>'POST')) !!}
    @include('userbookings.form')
{!! Form::close() !!}

Create Form (example input field)

<div class="row">
    <div class="col-md-3">
      <p>Party Size:</p>
    </div>
    <div class="col-md-9">
        <div class="form-group">
            <input required type="number" class="form-control" value="{{$guests}}" id='partySize' name='PartySize'>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

Store Method in Controller

public function store(Request $request)
{
    request()->validate([
      'date' => 'required',
      'timeFrom' => 'required',
      'timeTo' => 'required',
      'partySize' => 'required',
      'status' => 'required',
      'comments' => 'required',
    ]);

    Booking::create($request->all());
    return redirect()->route('user.bookings.index')
                     ->with('success','Booking created successfully');
}

Migration Code: 

  Schema::create('bookings', function (Blueprint $table) {
        $table->increments('id');
        $table->integer('user_id')->unsigned();
        $table->foreign('user_id')->references('id')->on('users');
        **$table->string('date');**
        **$table->string('timeFrom');**
        $table->string('timeTo');
        **$table->string('partySize');**
        $table->string('status');
        $table->text('comments');
        **$table->text('businessID');**
        $table->timestamps();
    });

items.body_markdown:
I'm having a requirement to create a web service which will be issuing some commands to an USB based hardware device (connected to my server machine directly) based on some incoming request parameters and serve responses to user according to the hardware's response to the command issued.

I could do this with my local host machine (by deploying my web service) but my question is - 

Can I deploy my web service on AWS EC2 instance or any other AWS service, where I can connect the hardware device to it and make it a web server, just like I connected to my local host server ?
items.title: Connecting hardware devices to AWS EC2 instance
items.body:
I'm having a requirement to create a web service which will be issuing some commands to an USB based hardware device (connected to my server machine directly) based on some incoming request parameters and serve responses to user according to the hardware's response to the command issued.

I could do this with my local host machine (by deploying my web service) but my question is -

Can I deploy my web service on AWS EC2 instance or any other AWS service, where I can connect the hardware device to it and make it a web server, just like I connected to my local host server ?

items.body_markdown:
I use the below command from cmd to perform unit testing.

    path\to\vstest.console.exe path\to\test.dll \enablecodecoverage

This works but the functions under test call some API's which need `SE_TCB_NAME` privilege.Therefore i run `vstestconsole.exe` with `psexec.exe` as below

    psexec.exe -s -i cmd.exe 
and then on the newly launched cmd,

    path\to\vstest.console.exe path\to\test.dll \enablecodecoverage

The contentious portion of code that needs service context is executed, but then the code coverage report is empty.
How can i run `vstest.console.exe` in system context?
items.title: Run vstest.console.exe in service context (visual studio unit testing)
items.body:
I use the below command from cmd to perform unit testing.

path\to\vstest.console.exe path\to\test.dll \enablecodecoverage

This works but the functions under test call some API's which need SE_TCB_NAME privilege.Therefore i run vstestconsole.exe with psexec.exe as below

psexec.exe -s -i cmd.exe

and then on the newly launched cmd,

path\to\vstest.console.exe path\to\test.dll \enablecodecoverage

The contentious portion of code that needs service context is executed, but then the code coverage report is empty. How can i run vstest.console.exe in system context?

items.title: Creating a dialog that has dynamic header
items.body:
I'm trying to create a dialog that has dynamic header. the behaviour desired is:

When I click on the button I update the value of a variable (var) in the backing bean and call a method (updateDialogHeader) that sets another variable (headerDialog) to a text depending on the value of (var). This same button will show a dialog that its header is equal to the contenent of headerDialog.

I use the following code:

XHTML page

<h:form>
<p:commandButton value="?" update="formDialog" action="#{backingBean.methodUpdate (1)}" oncomplete="myDialog.show()"/>
</h:form>

<h:form id="formDialog">
<p:dialog widgetVar="myDialog" position="center" modal="true" header="#{backingBean.headerDialog}" width="400" >
</p:dialog>
</h:form>

Backing bean

public void methodUpdate (int param) {
        var= param;
        headerDialog = updateHeaderDialog();
    }

public String updateHeaderDialog() {
if (var== 1) {
            return "Header one";
        }
        if (var== 2) {
            return "Header two";
        }
   return "";
}

Using the rpevious code shows superimposed dialogs the 1st dialog is an a dialog without header, the 2nd is the desired dialog (with the proper header). Clicking again on the button shows 3 dialogs the 1st one is the desired, the 2nd a dialog without header and the 3rd is the desired dialog wthi header. Notice, the more I click the more I get more dialogs.

Please help me. I don't understand where am I mistaking.

items.body_markdown:
I need a controller in MVC to accept arbitrary JSON, I know that two values will always be in the JSON, but I don't know the format of the rest of the payload reliably enough to be able to put it to a static type.

I've tried using dynamic model to access it but no luck, always seems to be an empty object.

I did fix it by reading the Request data stream manually, but it seems a bit flaky and a bit of a hack. Is there any other ways to do it? Even if I could bind it as string that would work fine, but if application/json is set in content-type in the request headers it seems to always try and parse it as JSON.
items.title: Accepting arbitrary JSON in ASP.NET MVC5 controller
items.body:
I need a controller in MVC to accept arbitrary JSON, I know that two values will always be in the JSON, but I don't know the format of the rest of the payload reliably enough to be able to put it to a static type.

I've tried using dynamic model to access it but no luck, always seems to be an empty object.

I did fix it by reading the Request data stream manually, but it seems a bit flaky and a bit of a hack. Is there any other ways to do it? Even if I could bind it as string that would work fine, but if application/json is set in content-type in the request headers it seems to always try and parse it as JSON.

items.title: Can't pickle decorated function wrapped within Class decorator
items.body:
I want to enable a communication between my two processes (one is an infinite loop with handlers), but i'm struggling to pickle a wrapped function within my Class decorator.

Here is my purpose:

I'm using a class that runs every functions of the class one by one script_debug_001 to send and receive D-Bus messages. In this script I need to create a new process to launch the infinte loop whose handlers are calling decorated functions. I want these decorated functions to be wrapped and pickled to a manager that allows me to access the same object in both process (the one which runs script_debug_001 and the one which runs the loop) otherwise I cannot access to the object which is manipulated by the loop.

I went thorugh multiple topics that looked quite similar to mine (Pickling decorated callable class wrapper, Python multiprocessing pickling error) and I had a look to the "What can be pickled and unpickled?" section of the documentation (https://docs.python.org/3/library/pickle.html#what-can-be-pickled-and-unpickled) but still I didn't manage to solve my problem. I saw a lot of times people speaking about using dill for this kind of purpose but still I'd like to solve my problem without using it, if it's possible.

Here are my files:

Emitter.py

import dbus
import dbus.service
import dbus.glib
from asyncore import loop
class Emitter(dbus.service.Object):
    def __init__(self, bus_name, object_path):
        #Initialisation du service d'émission
        dbus.service.Object.__init__(self, bus_name, object_path)     
    @dbus.service.signal('tld.domain.sub.emitter')
    def send_msg(self, msg):
        print("Emitted send_msg")    
    @dbus.service.signal('tld.domain.sub.emitter')
    def start_loop(self, loop):
        print("Emitted start_loop")            
    @dbus.service.signal('tld.domain.sub.emitter')
    def stop_loop(self, loop):
        print("Emitted quit_signal")

Receiver.py

import dbus.service
import dbus.glib
import gi.repository.GLib
import dbus
from modules.dbus.module_dbus import *
class Receiver(dbus.service.Object):
    loop = None
    def __init__(self, bus_name, object_path, loop):
        dbus.service.Object.__init__(self, bus_name, object_path)
        self.loop = loop    
    @dbus.service.method('tld.domain.sub.receiver')
    def print_msg_slot(self, msg):
        print_msg(msg)        
    @dbus.service.method('tld.domain.sub.receiver')
    def start_receiver_slot(self, loop):
        start_receiver(loop)   
    @dbus.service.method('tld.domain.sub.receiver')
    def stop_receiver_slot(self, loop):
        stop_receiver(loop)    
    @dbus.service.method('tld.domain.sub.receiver')
    def error_detected(self):
        raise Exception('Oops!')

verification_tool.py:

import functools
import multiprocessing

class verificationtool(object):

    manager = multiprocessing.Manager()
    dict = manager.dict()
    def __init__(self, func):
        self.func = func
        self.nbCall = 0
        self.results = {}
        functools.wraps(func)(self)
        self.__class__.dict[func.__name__] = self       
    def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        result = self.func(*args, **kwargs)
        self.nbCall += 1
        self.results[self.nbCall] = result
        return result

    def get_nbCall(self):
        return self.nbCall

    def set_nbCall(self, newNbCall):
        self.nbCall = newNbCall

@verificationtool
def print_msg(msg):
    try:
        print("Got message :\n" + msg)
    except:
        raise Exception('Impossible to display the D-Bus message')

@verificationtool
def start_receiver(loop):
    try:
        print("Start receiver...")
        loop.run()
    except:
        raise Exception('Impossible to start D-Bus Receiver')

@verificationtool
def stop_receiver(loop):
    print("Stopping receiver...")
    try:
        loop.quit()
        print("Receiver stopped")
    except:
        raise Exception('Impossible to stop D-Bus Receiver')

And the test class, script_debug_001.py:

import modules.dbus.verification_tool 
import modules.dbus.module_dbus
import modules.dbus.emitter_dbus
import modules.dbus.receiver_dbus 
from multiprocessing import Process

emitter = ''
receiver = ''
new_process = ''
loop = ''
manager = '' 

class TestDebug001(MainTest):
    def __init__(self, mfd_restart):
        super().__init__(mfd_restart)
        self.lock = threading.RLock()
        self.nbIte = 0

    @describe_function("Préphase brique ETAOUV_IHM | Init DDS")
    def phase_prerequis(self):
        global emitter, receiver, new_process, loop, manager

        session_bus_emitter = modules.dbus.module_dbus.create_session_bus()
        session_bus_receiver = modules.dbus.module_dbus.create_session_bus(True)
        loop = modules.dbus.module_dbus.create_loop()

        emitter = modules.dbus.emitter_dbus.Emitter(session_bus_emitter,'/tld/domain/sub/emitter')
        receiver = modules.dbus.receiver_dbus.Receiver(session_bus_receiver,'/tld/domain/sub/receiver', loop)

        modules.dbus.module_dbus.add_handler_to_bus(session_bus_receiver)
        modules.dbus.module_dbus.add_receiver(session_bus_receiver, receiver.print_msg_slot, 'tld.domain.sub.emitter', 'send_msg')
        modules.dbus.module_dbus.add_receiver(session_bus_receiver, receiver.stop_receiver_slot, 'tld.domain.sub.emitter', 'stop_loop')
        modules.dbus.module_dbus.add_receiver(session_bus_receiver, receiver.start_receiver_slot, 'tld.domain.sub.emitter', 'start_loop')


        manager = modules.dbus.verification_tool.verificationtool.manager
        manager.start()

        new_process = Process(target=receiver.start_receiver_slot, args=(loop,))
        new_process.start()

        time.sleep(5)

    @describe_function("Sending a D-Bus message...")
    def test_phase01(self):
        global emitter, receiver, manager

        emitter.send_msg('Testing a function')
        time.sleep(1)
        func_print_msg = manager.get()
        print("nbCall in script = {}".format(func_print_msg.get_nbCall()))      

        if func_print_msg.get_nbCall() is not None: 
            return testIsOk(self, "bien ouej", get_func_name())
        else:
            return testIsNok(self, "pas bien ouej", "raté", get_func_name())

    @describe_function("Stop D-Bus")
    def phase_posttest(self):
        global emitter, receiver, new_process, loop

        new_process.terminate()
        super().end_postphase()
        return testIsOk(self, "well done!", get_func_name())

Here is the error message I get when I try to store the verificationtool object into the dictionary of the manager:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./launch_test.py", line 21, in <module>
    from modules.import_modules.import_helper import *
  File "/home/nicolas/testo/archi_v2/modules/import_modules/import_helper.py", line 49, in <module>
    import camps
  File "/home/nicolas/testo/archi_v2/camps.py", line 30, in <module>
    from scripts_tests.script_debug_001 import *
  File "/home/nicolas/testo/archi_v2/scripts_tests/script_debug_001.py", line 2, in <module>
    import modules.dbus.verification_tool 
  File "/home/nicolas/testo/archi_v2/modules/dbus/verification_tool.py", line 45, in <module>
    @verificationtool
  File "/home/nicolas/testo/archi_v2/modules/dbus/verification_tool.py", line 21, in __init__
    self.__class__.dict[func.__name__] = self
  File "<string>", line 2, in __setitem__
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/multiprocessing/managers.py", line 716, in _callmethod
    conn.send((self._id, methodname, args, kwds))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/multiprocessing/connection.py", line 206, in send
    self._send_bytes(ForkingPickler.dumps(obj))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/multiprocessing/reduction.py", line 50, in dumps
    cls(buf, protocol).dump(obj)
_pickle.PicklingError: Can't pickle <function print_msg at 0x7f830a73b9d8>: attribute lookup print_msg on modules.dbus.verification_tool failed

After readings the different topics, I think it's because the decorated functions are not in the top-level module, but I don't really get how I can do that in my case.

items.title: Is @Recovery method necessary when using Spring-Retry?
items.body:
My question is regarding spring-retry. Assume a simple sample code where I have a the Service layer and Controller class.,

This is the testService Interface

public interface testService{
   @Retryable(value = { KnownExceptiomn.class }, backoff = @Backoff(delay = 1000), maxAttempts = 2)
   Address getAddress(String emailAddress);
}

This is the implementation of the service

public class testServiceImpl{
public Address getAddress(String emailAddress){
   //addressRepository is a crud repository
   return addressRepository.getAddressFromEmail(emailAddress);
   }
}

And the controller is

    @GetMapping("path/{emailId}")
    public ResponseEntity<?> getAddress(@PathVariable("emailId") final String email){
      final Address address;
      try{
        address= testService.getAddress(String emailAddress);
        if(address != null) return new ResponseEntity<Address>(address,HttpStatus.OK);

        return new ResponseEntity<String>("Invalid Email", HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST);
        }catch(KnownException e){
   return errorMessage("Error");
       }

}

As seen the @Retryble is in the Service interface. However I have not implemented an @Recover method. My thought here was since i dont really have any secondary DB and If the DB is down there really isn't a recovery option I did not add a @Recovery method. Instead the exception was caught in the controller and handled.

My questions are:

  1. Is the above approach wrong. If so, how to do it the right way?
  2. Is it always necessary to have a recovery method? If so what would be recovery in these kind of scenarios like DB being down and no alternative source of Data.

  3. Is it wrong to catch exceptions in controller and handle them accordingly? (I was told the service lay should handle all the exceptions in some discussions).

    Everywhere I've see is some sort of recovery method but couldn't find a solid example with proper recovery handler for this type of scenario if there is.

items.body_markdown:
while running spark job I get OOM exception looking at the stack trace I find that the `physicalPlanDescription` is too big:

it is created here: (org.apache.spark.sql.execution.QueryExecution line: 206)

    private def completeString(appendStats: Boolean): String = {
    ...
    ...
    s"""== Parsed Logical Plan ==
       |${stringOrError(logical.treeString(verbose = true))}
       |== Analyzed Logical Plan ==
       |$analyzedPlan
       |== Optimized Logical Plan ==
       |${stringOrError(optimizedPlanString)}
       |== Physical Plan ==
       |${stringOrError(executedPlan.treeString(verbose = true))}
    """.stripMargin.trim
    }


It is created for the UI according to the note in the code. 

1) What can I do? already using a driver with a 20G Heap.  

2) Why is this string not lazy? why should it be computed always?

I also open Issue: [Apache Spark][1]

As asked sample code: [link][2]

run with `-XX:+UseG1GC`

Just to be clear this code creates a very big plan, my real code is much more complex many tables that join to each other filtering and many `case when` statements.
So please do not stick to the fact that this sample code actually does nothing.


  [1]: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-23904
  [2]: https://gist.github.com/igreenfield/584c3336f03ba7d63e9026774eaf5e23

items.title: How to use `bodyParser.raw()` to get raw body?
items.body:
I am creating a web API using Express. The feature is to allow API users to send a file to the server.

Here's my app setup code:

var express = require('express');
var path = require('path');
// ...
var bodyParser = require('body-parser');

var routes = require('./routes/index');
var users = require('./routes/users');

// API routes
var images = require('./routes/api/img');

var app = express();

app.use(bodyParser.raw());
app.use(bodyParser.json());
app.use(bodyParser.urlencoded({ extended: false }));
app.use(express.static(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));

app.use('/', routes);
app.use('/api', images);

// ...

module.exports = app;

Please notice that I am using app.use(bodyParser.raw());.

How do I get the raw bytes from POST requests?

const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();

/* POST api/img */
router.post('/img', function(req, res, next) {

  // how do I get the raw bytes?

});

module.exports = router;

items.body_markdown:
I am working on an application where records are in billions and I need to make a query where GroupBy clause is needed.

**Table Schema:**

  

      CREATE TABLE event (
      eventId INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      eventTime INTEGER NOT NULL,
      sourceId INTEGER NOT NULL,
      plateNumber VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
      plateCodeId INTEGER NOT NULL,
      plateCountryId INTEGER NOT NULL,
      plateStateId INTEGER NOT NULL
    );
    
    
        CREATE TABLE source (
      sourceId INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
      sourceName VARCHAR(32) NOT NULL
    );


**Scenario:**

1. User will select sources, suppose source ID (1,2,3)

2. We need to get all events which occurred more than once for those source for event time range

3. Same event criteria (same platenumber, platecodeId, platestateId, plateCountryId)

I have prepared a query to perform above mentioned operation but its taking long time to execute. 

        select plateNumber, plateCodeId, plateStateId, 
        plateCountryId, sourceId,count(1) from event 
        where sourceId in (1,2,3) 
        group by sourceId, plateCodeId, plateStateId,
        plateCountryId, plateNumber
       having  count(1) > 1 limit 10 offset 0

**Can you recommend optimized query for it?**

Table Schema:

  eventTime INTEGER NOT NULL,
  sourceId INTEGER NOT NULL,
  plateNumber VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
  plateCodeId INTEGER NOT NULL,

);


    CREATE TABLE source (

);

Scenario:

  2. We need to get all events which occurred more than once for those source for event time range

items.title: C# On property change, run logic
items.body:
I have a C# Entity which is auto generated via database first:

public partial class Zone
{
    public Guid LocationId {get; set;}
    ...
}

What I need to do is run a function, Process() whenever LocationId is changed. Now normally I would alter the setter and job done, however because this is auto generated via database first, any "manual changes to the file will be overwritten if the code is regenerated."

What would be the best approach here?

The current thinking is to create a new partial class to do something like this:

public partial class Zone
{
    private Guid _pendingLocationId
    public Guid PendingLocationId {
      get { return _pendingLocationId }
      set { 
        Guid updatedLocation = Process(value) ?? value;
        _pendingLocationId = updatedLocation;
        locationId = updatedLocation;
      }
    }
}

Just a note; the unfortunate reality is that there is probably zero chance of us integrating a new framework or library into the application at this stage.

In response to the possible duplicate flag; Unless I have misread, this would require us re-mapping /encapsulating all of our Zone references into a new class, not only pushing this out to all the views, but also editing many linq queries etc. If someone can identify why this would be the preferred solution over my own suggested solve, then please let me know.

items.body_markdown:
I've started dabbling with @angular/service-worker. So i created a simple app, which should, when offline, load the last image it has shown when you were online. I couldn't figure out how to do that, so i just added a static img. This is not the problem, but it wouldn't hurt to know how to do it. I've been trying to make it work for 4 days now.

When i go offline, i get a 504, page isn't working error. If i keep reloading, nothing happens. If i visit another link and then go back to the page, the page loads files from cache and it works. Then if i reload again, i get the error.
The local file also doesn't load when i visit the page from image, so i just get see the image is missing icon.

I've tried this fix, but it still doesn't work https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48565629/how-to-handle-routing-in-angular-5-service-workers

gh-pages https://github.com/pungiish/PWA/tree/gh-pages

master https://github.com/pungiish/PWA/tree/master

link to github pages https://pungiish.github.io/PWA/

items.title: Ffmpeg returning error code 1 in AWS Lamda function
items.body:
I'm running a lambda function which takes an mp4 video, and adds a watermark of a png image over the top of it in the bottom right hand corner (with a 10px margin). It then outputs that image to a temporary location. It keeps failing with Error code 1, but that isn't very helpful. I'm using a binary version of ffmpeg that is specified in the main directory of the code. I know that ffmpeg is set up correctly due to using it in another lambda function in this way, which works. But adding an overlay fails. Here is the relevant part of my code:

function addWatermark(next) {
    var ffmpeg = child_process.spawn("ffmpeg", [
      "-i", target, // url to stream from
      "-i", watermarkPath,
      "-filter_complex" ,"[0:v][1:v] overlay=x=W-w-10:y=H-h-10",
      "-c:a", "copy",
      "pipe:1"
    ]);
    ffmpeg.on("error", function(err) {
      console.log(err);
    })
    ffmpeg.on("close", function(code) {
      if (code != 0 ) {
        console.log("child process exited with code " + code); // Always exits here.
      } else {
        console.log("Processing finished !");
      }
      tmpFile.end(); 
      next(code);
    });
    tmpFile.on("error", function(err) {
      console.log("stream err: ", err);
    });
    ffmpeg.on("end", function() {
      tmpFile.end();  
    })
    ffmpeg.stdout.pipe(tmpFile)
    .on("error", function(err){
      console.log("error while writing: ",err);
    });
}

Can anyone spot what may be wrong?

items.title: Laravel - Jquery data-repeater-item binding to a report tab
items.body:
I want to bind data from jQuery data-repeater-item to a report tabs, when we click on create a new item, I want to add a new row in the report with all data from the repeater item.

So far, I've only managed to bind 1 item in the report instead of Y item. (Y is the number of time that we repeate the list.)

I think that I will need a foreach loop but i don't know how to do

For now, my code look like this :

<div data-repeater-item class="row">
    <select class="form-control" name="position">
        <option value="Front right">Front right</option>
        <option value="Front left">Front left</option>
    </select>
</div>

When I check my report in the Tabs4, I display the value of the position using jQuery

Html from using a blade template for loop 

<div class="form-group">
    <label class="control-label col-md-3 sbold">Tyre Position:</label>
    <div class="col-md-4">
        <p class="form-control-static" data-display="tyre[{{ $number }}][position]"></p>
    </div>
</div>

The Js 

$('#tab3, .form-control-static', form).each(function () {

    var input = $('[name="' + $(this).attr("data-display") + '"]', form);

    if (input.is(":radio")) {
        input = $('[name="' + $(this).attr("data-display") + '"]:checked', form);
    }

    if (input.is(":text") || input.is("textarea")) {
        $(this).html(input.val().replace(/\n/g, "<br />"));
    } else if (input.is("select")) {
        $(this).html(input.find('option:selected').text());
    } else if (input.is(":radio") && input.is(":checked")) {
        $(this).html(input.attr("data-title"));
    }
});

If you need more information to guide me to the good way to fix this. (don't know if it's a good sentence)

Thanks for your help

items.body_markdown:
I am trying to split video into multiple photos, but when I use AVAssetImageGenerator I can only get photo for 0.0s, 0.5s, 0.1s etc


But how can I get e.g. 10 photos per second?

    let imageGenerator = AVAssetImageGenerator(asset: asset)
            imageGenerator.appliesPreferredTrackTransform = true
            
            var times = [NSValue]()
            for i in 0..<5 {
                let t = Double(i) / 5 * 60
                times.append(NSValue(time: CMTimeMake(Int64(t), 60)))
            }
            
            imageGenerator.generateCGImagesAsynchronously(forTimes: times) { (time, imageRef, time2, result, error) in

Resulting frame times

    time time2
    0.0 0.0
    0.2 0.0
    0.4 0.5005
    0.6 0.5005
    0.8 1.001
items.title: AVAssetImageGenerator gives image to far away from desired time
items.body:
I am trying to split video into multiple photos, but when I use AVAssetImageGenerator I can only get photo for 0.0s, 0.5s, 0.1s etc

But how can I get e.g. 10 photos per second?

let imageGenerator = AVAssetImageGenerator(asset: asset)
        imageGenerator.appliesPreferredTrackTransform = true

        var times = [NSValue]()
        for i in 0..<5 {
            let t = Double(i) / 5 * 60
            times.append(NSValue(time: CMTimeMake(Int64(t), 60)))
        }

        imageGenerator.generateCGImagesAsynchronously(forTimes: times) { (time, imageRef, time2, result, error) in

Resulting frame times

time time2
0.0 0.0
0.2 0.0
0.4 0.5005
0.6 0.5005
0.8 1.001

items.body_markdown:
> Angular CLI: 1.7.3 Node: 9.3.0 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 5.2.9 ...
> animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... http,
> language-service, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic,
> router
> 
> @angular/cdk: 5.2.4 @angular/cli: 1.7.3 @angular/flex-layout:
> 5.0.0-beta.13 @angular/material: 5.2.4 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer: 0.3.2 @angular-devkit/core: 0.3.2
> @angular-devkit/schematics: 0.3.2 @ngtools/json-schema: 1.2.0
> @ngtools/webpack: 1.10.2 @schematics/angular: 0.3.2
> @schematics/package-update: 0.3.2 typescript: 2.6.2 webpack: 3.11.0

I have a material 2 table component that ran nicely with plain RxJS and typed Array.

So I took it to next level using NGRX

my redux ngrx state is working beautifully spreading my typed array thru the reducer into my ngrx state nicely

at the component level I have a container that propagates users$ using @Input() as input to my table component and I construct an empty MatTableDataSource at construction

container component

<app-table [users$]="usersState$ | async"></app-table>

table component

> @Input() users$: Observable<IUser[]>;
>     displayedColumns = ['_id', 'emailAddress', 'password', 'createdAt', 'updatedAt'];
>     dataSource = new MatTableDataSource();

I cannot get my ngrx state users: <IUser[]>
wired into MatTableDataSource properly

here is my RxJS logic

> onChange(changes: SimpleChanges) {
>         this.users$
>             .map(users => this.dataSource.data = users); }


console error follows...

> ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot add property
> _resolvedData, object is not extensible TypeError: Cannot add property _resolvedData, object is not extensible
>     at MapSubscriber.eval [as project] (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/@angular/router/esm5/router.js:4038:34)
>     at MapSubscriber._next (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/operators/map.js:82:35)
>     at MapSubscriber.Subscriber.next (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Subscriber.js:97:18)
>     at ScalarObservable._subscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/observable/ScalarObservable.js:53:24)
>     at ScalarObservable.Observable._trySubscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Observable.js:178:25)
>     at ScalarObservable.Observable.subscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Observable.js:166:93)
>     at MapOperator.call (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/operators/map.js:60:23)

I tried several attempts to get the typed array out of the observable
.switchMap causes ERROR TypeError: this.users$.switchMap is not a function

.subscribe causes ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot add property _resolvedData, object is not extensible

.map causes ERROR TypeError: this.users$.map is not a function


I am also wondering is there is a an unseen peer dependency lapse with libraries under the hood with RxJS
items.title: how to wire redux STATE typed array into mattabledatasource

@angular/cdk: 5.2.4 @angular/cli: 1.7.3 @angular/flex-layout: 5.0.0-beta.13 @angular/material: 5.2.4 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer: 0.3.2 @angular-devkit/core: 0.3.2 @angular-devkit/schematics: 0.3.2 @ngtools/json-schema: 1.2.0 @ngtools/webpack: 1.10.2 @schematics/angular: 0.3.2 @schematics/package-update: 0.3.2 typescript: 2.6.2 webpack: 3.11.0

I have a material 2 table component that ran nicely with plain RxJS and typed Array.

So I took it to next level using NGRX

my redux ngrx state is working beautifully spreading my typed array thru the reducer into my ngrx state nicely

at the component level I have a container that propagates users$ using @Input() as input to my table component and I construct an empty MatTableDataSource at construction

container component

table component

@Input() users$: Observable; displayedColumns = ['_id', 'emailAddress', 'password', 'createdAt', 'updatedAt']; dataSource = new MatTableDataSource();

I cannot get my ngrx state users: wired into MatTableDataSource properly

here is my RxJS logic

onChange(changes: SimpleChanges) { this.users$ .map(users => this.dataSource.data = users); }

console error follows...

ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot add property _resolvedData, object is not extensible TypeError: Cannot add property _resolvedData, object is not extensible at MapSubscriber.eval [as project] (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/@angular/router/esm5/router.js:4038:34) at MapSubscriber._next (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/operators/map.js:82:35) at MapSubscriber.Subscriber.next (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Subscriber.js:97:18) at ScalarObservable._subscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/observable/ScalarObservable.js:53:24) at ScalarObservable.Observable._trySubscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Observable.js:178:25) at ScalarObservable.Observable.subscribe (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/Observable.js:166:93) at MapOperator.call (webpack-internal:///./node_modules/rxjs/_esm5/operators/map.js:60:23)

I tried several attempts to get the typed array out of the observable .switchMap causes ERROR TypeError: this.users$.switchMap is not a function

.subscribe causes ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot add property _resolvedData, object is not extensible

.map causes ERROR TypeError: this.users$.map is not a function
